channel.title: Lecture Notes on MIT OpenCourseWare
channel.description: Recent content in Lecture Notes on MIT OpenCourseWare

item.title: app1_reli_final.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on series and parallel systems, m-out-of-n systems, more complicated system configurations, and systems that share the load.

item.title: app10_storm_ty.pdf
item.description: This resource contains the information on the topic ‘Relation between Storm Duration and Precipitation Intensity’.

item.title: app11_max.pdf
item.description: This file contains the notes on the topic ‘Distribution of the Maximum of Independent Identically-Distributed Variables’.

item.title: app12_waveloads.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the following topics: The Ocean Surface and the Distribution of Wave Height, Maximum Wave Height in a Storm, Maximum Wave Load During a Single Storm, and Maximum Annual Load.

item.title: app13_col_loads.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topic: Second Moment Analysis of Column Load and Design Load F*.

item.title: app14_settlem.pdf
item.description: This file explains the mechanical model,and analysis of uncertainty.

item.title: app15_noisy_obs.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topics: Conditional Distributions of Variables with Joint Normal Distribution, Application to Noisy Observations, and Best Linear Unbiased Estimation (BLUE) Theory.

item.title: app16_rain_pred.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topics: Conditional Distribution Results for Jointly Normal Vectors, and Prediction of Daily Temperatures.

item.title: app17_slope_rel.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topics: First-Order Second-Moment (FOSM) Reliability Index, Second-Moment (SM) Reliability Index,and Monte Carlo Simulation.

item.title: app18_est_fin.pdf
item.description: This file contains the topics: Method of Moments (MOM, Maximum Likelihood (ML),and Bayesian Estimation.

item.title: app19_fin_regs.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topics: Fitting a Simple Linear Regression Model, Testing the Statistical Significance of the Regression, and Comments on the Appropriateness of the Modeling Assumptions.

item.title: app2_hazards.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topic ‘Evaluation of Natural and Man-Made Risks’.

item.title: app3_fedra.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the bayes’ theorem on the basis of the topic ‘Extra-Terrestrial Life and the Design of Experiments’.

item.title: app4_eqk_pred.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topic ‘Earthquake Prediction from Imperfect Premonitory Signs’.

item.title: app5_rain_norain.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topic ‘Is the Series of Rainy/Non-Rainy Days a Bernoulli Trial Sequence?’ on the basis of Bernoulli trial sequence and dependence in binary time series.

item.title: app6_buses_eqs.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topics: The Poisson Process,and Renewal Processes.

item.title: app7_mixtures_fin.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topic ‘Distribution Mixtures’.

item.title: app8_hazard_func.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the reliability of old and new items using the hazard function.

item.title: app9_wind_reliab.pdf
item.description: This file discusses ‘Reliability of a Building Under Extreme Wind Loads - Choosing The Design Wind Speed’ using independent random variables.

item.title: briefnts1_events.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topics: Definitions, Operations with events, Properties of events, Probability of events, Conditional Probability, and Total Probability Theorem.

item.title: briefnts10_estmn.pdf
item.description: This file contains the notes for chi square distribution, F distribution, and t distribution.

item.title: briefnts11_regrs.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topics Simple Linear Regression, and Multiple Linear Regression.

item.title: briefnts2_disdbn.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topics: Discrete Distributions, Examples of Discrete Probability Distributions, and poisson distributions.

item.title: briefnts3_contdb.pdf
item.description: This file discusses continuous distributions, examples of probability continuous distributions, exponential distribution, and hazard distribution.

item.title: briefnts4_randvt.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topics: Discrete Random Vectors, Continuous Random Vectors, Independent Random Variables.

item.title: briefnts5_funct.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the functions of one random variable, and function of two or more variables.

item.title: briefnts6_smfosm.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the second moment(SM) and first-order-second-moment (FOSM)propagation of uncertainty.

item.title: briefnts7_con_sm.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the important result for jointly normally distributed variables X1 and X2.

item.title: briefnts8_relnl.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topic ‘Relationships between Mean and Variance of Normal and Lognormal Distributions’.

item.title: briefnts9_reliab.pdf
item.description: This file discusses the topic ‘Calculation of Reliability Index, Beta’.

item.title: Lecture Notes
item.description: There are two parts to the lecture notes for this class: The Brief Note, which is a summary of the topics discussed in class, and the Application Example, which gives real-wolrd examples of the topics covered. WEEKÂ # TOPICS BRIEF NOTES APPLICATION EXAMPLES Part 1: Introduction to Probability 1 Events and their Probability, Elementary Operations with Events, Total Probability Theorem, Independence, Bayes’ Theorem 1 (PDF) 1 (PDF) 2 (PDF) 3 (PDF)
